title: Belgian pop star Angèle spreads her wings
summary: She undoubtedly left her mark on 2024 with her captivating performance of 'Nightcall' alongside Phoenix and Kavinsky at the Olympic Games closing ceremony. The 29-year-old artist had come out of her last triumphant tour in September 2023 feeling exhausted. She is now working on her third album, with a new perspective.

title: France and Mexico's tug-of-war over restitution of Aztec and Mayan treasures
summary: An indigenous Mexican nation has written to the Assemblée Nationale seeking the return of its codex, arguing that the centuries-old manuscript describes traditions it still continues. Radical-left lawmakers have promised to support the request, which has been rejected by Paris in the past.

title: Syria says 14 'interior ministry personnel' killed in 'ambush'
summary: Interior Minister Mohammed Abdel Rahman called the attack a 'treacherous ambush by remnants of the criminal regime' in Tartus province 'while performing their tasks of maintaining security and safety.'

title: More than 1,500 prisoners escape in Mozambique amid post-election unrest
summary: Among those attempting to escape, 33 were killed and 15 wounded in clashes with prison staff, said national police chief Bernardino Rafael at a press conference.

title: Zelensky condemns Russian 'inhumane' Christmas attack on energy grid
summary: Russia launched over 170 missiles and drones on the country's power grid on Christmas Day, killing an energy worker.

title: After the 2024 Olympics, the flip side of the medals for some French athletes: Loss of morale, blues and burnout
summary: Once the Olympics and Paralympics are over, French sportsmen and women often find it difficult to move on from the event, whether they've suffered a setback or, on the contrary, been crowned with success.

title: Pope calls for 'arms to be silenced' in Christmas message
summary: Francis used his traditional Urbi et Orbi message to call for talks for a just peace in Ukraine, Sudan and the Middle East.

title: Azerbaijani jet crashes in Kazakhstan leaving 32 survivors
summary: Kazakhstan's emergency ministry said 67 people were on board the Embraer 190 aircraft.

title: At the Moulin Rouge, champagne never stops flowing
summary: Some 250,000 bottles of champagne are consumed every year at the Pigalle cabaret, where 50 waiters serve 900 guests every evening in a ballet that swirls and sparkles just like the stage shows.

title: Life as a parent, my 2024 retrospective
summary: For the last 'Darons Daronnes' newsletter of the year, Clara Georges delves into the yearly summaries made by the apps that have monitored her daily life.

title: The complex challenge of rebuilding Mayotte after Cyclone Chido
summary: Rehousing inhabitants of shantytowns, securing access to land and materials, navigating building regulations... Rebuilding the French Indian Ocean territory raises countless questions.

title: Impeached South Korean president defies Christmas summons
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol, a former prosecutor, also failed to attend a hearing he was summoned to last Wednesday, not explaining his absence. Yoon faces impeachment and criminal charges of insurrection, which could result in life imprisonment or even the death penalty.

title: Five châteaus around Paris to visit with family over the festive season
summary: To attract family audiences, the châteaux of the Ile-de-France region are working overtime on their inventive programming. It is an opportunity to extend Christmas cheer in a majestic setting.

title: At Paris's Mamiche bakery, Cécile Khayat and Victoria Effantin bake with a joyful touch
summary: Since 2017, the dynamic, talent-packed duo has been baking breads, pastries and sandwiches in the heart of Paris. The key to their success? 100% homemade products sold in a cheerful, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Miraculous rescue of 11-year-old in the Mediterranean moves Italy
summary: A sailing boat operated by an NGO discovered the shipwreck survivor by chance in the middle of the night, while humanitarian efforts are being deliberately obstructed by Giorgia Meloni's far-right government.

title: Twenty not-to-be-missed shows in Paris and beyond this December
summary: Theater, opera, dance, comedy, circus, storytelling, puppetry: Le Monde's critics have selected the performances to book for the end of the year.

title: A lack of trust that goes unnoticed between Poland and Ukraine
summary: Although Warsaw is still Kyiv's first advocate in its aspirations to join the European Union and NATO, behind the scenes relations are tense, particularly around the memory of the Volhynia massacre.

title: In Brazil, donkeys are slaughtered to produce a remedy for traditional Chinese medicine
summary: Since 2018, an average of 38,600 donkeys have been killed each year, leading to a 60% reduction in the population between 2018 and 2023. The species is now threatened with extinction in the country.
